meanings.def: to move easily over a smooth or wet surface; to make something move in this way
examples: As I turned left on a bend, my car started to slide.
+ adv./prep. We slid down the grassy slope.
A plane slid off the runway in Denver on Sunday.
The drawers slide in and out easily.
slide something + adv./prep. She slid her hand along the rail.
You can slide the front seats forward if necessary.
slide + adj The automatic doors slid open.
slide something + adj. Quietly, she slid the drawer shut.
Tears slid slowly down his pale cheek.
The melting snow began to slide from the sloping roofs.
a vehicle that will slide smoothly across snow

meanings.def: to move quickly and quietly, for example in order not to be noticed; to make something move in this way
examples: + adv./prep. He slid into bed.
She slid out while no one was looking.
slide something + adv./prep. The man slid the money quickly into his pocket.
He slid a shy look at Claire.
The moon slid silently behind a cloud.
Her eyes slid away from his own in embarrassment.

meanings.def: to become gradually lower or of less value
examples: Shares slid to a 10-year low.

meanings.def: to move gradually into a worse situation
examples: The industry has slid into decline.
They were sliding towards bankruptcy.
He got depressed and began to let things slide (= failed to give things the attention they needed).
The Hong Kong economy was sliding into recession.
The economy is sliding rapidly downhill.

meanings.def: one page of an electronic presentation, that may contain text and images, that is usually viewed on a computer screen or projected onto a larger screen
examples: Here's a slide showing target markets.
I'm still working on the slides for my presentation.
in/on a slide Limit the amount of text on each slide.
The numbers mentioned in the slide are based on theoretical scenarios.
a slide presentation

meanings.def: a long, smooth movement on ice or a smooth surface
examples: Her car went into a slide.
a front wheel slide

meanings.def: a change to a lower or worse condition
examples: a downward slide in the price of oil
the team’s slide down the table
talks to prevent a slide into civil war
The economy is on the slide (= getting worse).
a stock market slide
The country is continuing the slide into chaos and violence.
her slow slide into drug addiction
the market's recent slide towards panic
the start of a slippery slide down to family breakdown
to stop the slide in the dollar

meanings.def: a structure with a steep slope that children use for sliding down
examples: to go down the slide
He wouldn't go down the slide by himself.
There were lots on children on the slide.

meanings.def: a sudden fall of a large amount of rock or earth down a hill
examples: I was afraid of starting a slide of loose stones.

meanings.def: a small piece of film held in a frame that can be shown on a screen when you shine a light through it
examples: a talk with colour slides

meanings.def: a small piece of glass that something is placed on so that it can be looked at under a microscope
a part of a musical instrument or other device that slides backwards and forwards
a small attractive piece of metal or plastic used by women for holding their hair in place
